snippet: A cleanup job on a huge scale is under way at the Fresh Kills site on Staten Island, where the Army Corps of Engineers is helping to clear out an estimated four million cubic yards of debris.
abstract: Fresh Kills landfill on Staten Island, where tons of debris was sifted through after the Sept 11 terrorist attacks, has once again been enlisted after a disaster, this time to serve as the staging area for the monumental cleanup job under way since Hurricane Sandy hit; cleanup has turned into a 24-hour-a-day, military-scale operation at Fresh Kills, with the New York City Sanitation Department and the Army Corps of Engineers.

byline.original: By ERIC LIPTON and KIRK SEMPLE

lead_paragraph: A cleanup job on a huge scale is under way at the Fresh Kills site on Staten Island, where the Army Corps of Engineers is helping to clear out an estimated four million cubic yards of debris.

headline.seo: Cleanup From Hurricane Sandy Is Military-Style Operation
headline.main: At Landfill, Storm Cleanup Is Military-Style Effort
headline.print_headline: Storm Cleanup Is Military-Style Operation at Landfill on Staten Island
